data.chText: 方法；方式
data.enText: method/style

data.chText: 方法；手段；途径；方式
data.enText: a method, style or manner of doing sth

data.chText: 那样拿剪子不对。
data.enText: That's not the right way to hold a pair of scissors.

data.chText: 我不喜欢这种工作方法。
data.enText: I'm not happy with this way of working.

data.chText: 我讨厌她一贯批评我。
data.enText: I hate the way she always criticizes me.

data.chText: 我跟你说过我们原本应该用我的方法来做这事。
data.enText: I told you we should have done it my way !

data.chText: 传染病的感染途径有几种。
data.enText: Infectious diseases can be acquired in several ways.

data.chText: 我一般总能想方设法得到我想要的东西。
data.enText: I generally get what I want one way or another (= by some means) .

data.chText: 不能那样跟你妈妈说话！
data.enText: That's no way to speak to your mother!

data.chText: 问题不在于你说什么，而在于你怎么说。
data.enText: It's not what you say, it's the way that you say it.

data.chText: 行为
data.enText: behaviour

data.chText: 作风；风度；样子
data.enText: a particular manner or style of behaviour

data.chText: 他们友好地对她咧嘴笑了笑。
data.enText: They grinned at her in a friendly way .

data.chText: 承认自己犯了错误可不是他一贯的作风。
data.enText: It was not his way to admit that he had made a mistake.

data.chText: 如果她看上去不爱说话，别担心，她就是这么个人。
data.enText: Don't worry, if she seems quiet─ it's just her way .

data.chText: 他在炫耀，青春期的男孩都是这个样子。
data.enText: He was showing off, as is the way with adolescent boys.

data.chText: （群体的）行为方式，生活方式，习俗
data.enText: the typical way of behaving and living of a particular group of people

data.chText: 十年之后，我习惯了英国人的奇异习俗。
data.enText: After ten years I'm used to the strange British ways.

data.chText: 路线；道路
data.enText: route/road

data.chText: 路线；路；道路
data.enText: a route or road that you take in order to reach a place

data.chText: 从甲地到乙地最好的 / 最快的 / 最近的路线
data.enText: the best/quickest/shortest way from A to B

data.chText: 你能告诉我去莱斯特广场的路吗？
data.enText: Can you tell me the way to Leicester Square?

data.chText: 向某人问路
data.enText: to ask sb the way

data.chText: 我们绕了一个大圈子。
data.enText: We went the long way round .

data.chText: 行进路线；通路
data.enText: the route along which sb/sth is moving; the route that sb/sth would take if there was nothing stopping them/it

data.chText: 让开！我有急事。
data.enText: Get out of my way! I'm in a hurry.

data.chText: 手持盾牌的防暴警察堵住了示威者的路。
data.enText: Riot police with shields were blocking the demonstrators' way.

data.chText: 我们在茂密的植被中开出一条通路。
data.enText: We fought our way through the dense vegetation.

data.chText: 他们不幸在途中遇上了暴风雪。
data.enText: Unfortunately they ran into a snowstorm along the way.

data.chText: 路；小径；街道
data.enText: a road, path or street for travelling along

data.chText: 有一条路穿过田地。
data.enText: There's a way across the fields.

data.chText: （用于街道名称）路，道
data.enText: used in the names of streets

data.chText: 黑德利路106号
data.enText: 106 Headley Way

data.chText: 方向
data.enText: direction

data.chText: 某方向；往某方向
data.enText: a particular direction; in a particular direction

data.chText: 他们往哪边去了？
data.enText: Which way did they go?

data.chText: 我们差点被一辆从对面开过来的汽车撞上。
data.enText: We just missed a car coming the other way .

data.chText: 横过马路前要朝左右两边看一看。
data.enText: Look both ways (= look left and right) before crossing the road.

data.chText: 一定不要把这招牌挂颠倒了。
data.enText: Make sure that sign's the right way up .

data.chText: 孩子们四处奔跑。
data.enText: Kids were running this way and that (= in all directions) .

data.chText: 他们决定把钱分成四份。
data.enText: They decided to split the money four ways (= between four different people) .

data.chText: 你打算投哪边的票？
data.enText: Which way (= for which party) are you going to vote?

data.chText: 进入；离去
data.enText: for entering/leaving

data.chText: 出入通道；门口
data.enText: a means of going into or leaving a place, such as a door or gate

data.chText: 入 / 出口
data.enText: the way in/out

data.chText: 他们从后门逃走了。
data.enText: They escaped out the back way.

data.chText: 距离；时间
data.enText: distance/time
ways

data.chText: （两点之间的）距离，时间段
data.enText: a distance or period of time between two points

data.chText: 前面不远左手边就是现代艺术博物馆。
data.enText: A little way up on the left is the Museum of Modern Art.

data.chText: 那时离九月份还有很长一段时间。
data.enText: September was a long way off .

data.chText: 这个地区的葡萄酒业还远远没有完全成熟。
data.enText: The area's wine industry still has a way to go to full maturity.

data.chText: 你大老远地跑来看我们？
data.enText: You came all this way to see us?

data.chText: 我们还有很大的差距。
data.enText: We still have a ways to go .

data.chText: 地区
data.enText: area

data.chText: 地区；地带
data.enText: an area, a part of a country, etc.

data.chText: 我想他住在伦敦附近。
data.enText: I think he lives somewhere over London way .

data.chText: 下次我去你那一带时会顺道去看你的。
data.enText: I'll stop by and see you next time I'm down your way .

data.chText: 方面
data.enText: aspect

data.chText: 方面
data.enText: a particular aspect of sth

data.chText: 我已经完完全全变了。
data.enText: I have changed in every way.

data.chText: 从几方面看，这是不寻常的一天。
data.enText: It's been quite a day, one way and another (= for several reasons) .

data.chText: 情况；状态
data.enText: condition/state

data.chText: 情况；状态
data.enText: a particular condition or state

data.chText: 经济状况很糟。
data.enText: The economy's in a bad way .

data.chText: 按目前这样的情况，我不知道我们要如何应付。
data.enText: I don't know how we're going to manage, the way things are .
across the way
over the way

data.chText: 在街对面；在…对面
data.enText: on the other side of the street, etc.

data.chText: 从街对面那栋房子开着的窗户里传出嘈杂的音乐声。
data.enText: Music blared from the open window of the house across the way.
all the way
the whole way

data.chText: 一路上；自始至终
data.enText: during the whole journey/period of time

data.chText: 回家的一路上，她没对我说过一句话。
data.enText: She didn't speak a word to me all the way back home.

data.chText: 完全地；无保留地
data.enText: completely; as much as it takes to achieve what you want

data.chText: 我在全力和他对抗。
data.enText: I'm fighting him all the way.

data.chText: 你可以感觉到听众完全支持她。
data.enText: You can feel that the audience is with her all the way.
(that's/it's) always the way

data.chText: （表示经常如此，尤用于贬义）总是这样，老是
data.enText: used to say that things often happen in a particular way, especially when it is not convenient
any way you slice it

data.chText: 无论你如何看待
data.enText: however you choose to look at a situation
be/be born/be made that way

data.chText: 天性如此；生下就这样
data.enText: to behave or do things in a particular manner because it is part of your character

data.chText: 他如此自命不凡并不是他的错，他天生就是这种性格。
data.enText: It's not his fault he's so pompous─he was born that way.
be set in your ways

data.chText: 积习难改；秉性难移；执拗
data.enText: to have habits or opinions that you have had for a long time and that you do not want to change
by the way

data.chText: 顺便提一下；捎带说一声；附带问一句
data.enText: used to introduce a comment or question that is not directly related to what you have been talking about

data.chText: 顺便提一下，我找到了你在寻找的那本书。
data.enText: By the way, I found that book you were looking for.

data.chText: 顺便问一句，几点钟了？
data.enText: What's the time, by the way?

data.chText: 啊，对了，你要是看到杰基，告诉她我今晚给她打电话。
data.enText: Oh by the way, if you see Jackie, tell her I'll call her this evening.
by way of sth

data.chText: 路经；经过；经由
data.enText: by a route that includes the place mentioned

data.chText: 这位艺术家最近从保加利亚途经维也纳到了巴黎。
data.enText: The artist recently arrived in Paris from Bulgaria by way of Vienna.

data.chText: 她是念过戏剧学校后到电视台的。
data.enText: She came to TV by way of drama school.
by way of/in the way of sth

data.chText: 作为…的形式；为了；作为…的手段
data.enText: as a form of sth; for sth; as a means of sth

data.chText: 他得到那家公司600英镑的赔偿。
data.enText: He received £600 by way of compensation from the company.

data.chText: 她转动了一下眼睛作为回答就走了。
data.enText: She rolled her eyes by way of an answer and left.
come your way

data.chText: 意外落在…头上；偶尔发生在…身上
data.enText: to happen to you by chance, or when you were not expecting it

data.chText: 无论什么事落到他的头上，他都认了。
data.enText: He took whatever came his way.
cut both/two ways

data.chText: 两面都行得通（或说得通）；有利也有弊
data.enText: to have two opposite effects or results
either way
one way or the other

data.chText: 两者都一样
data.enText: used to say that it does not matter which one of two possibilities happens, is chosen or is true

data.chText: 是他的错或不是？无论是不是，都得有个解释。
data.enText: Was it his fault or not? Either way, an explanation is due.

data.chText: 我们可以在今天或明天见面，哪一天对我都行。
data.enText: We could meet today or tomorrow─I don't mind one way or the other.
every which way

data.chText: 四面八方；向各处
data.enText: in all directions

data.chText: 她的头发乱得像鸡窝。
data.enText: Her hair tumbled every which way.
get into/out of the way of (doing) sth

data.chText: 养成（或丢掉）…的习惯
data.enText: to become used to doing sth/to lose the habit of doing sth

data.chText: 这些女人养成了每天晚上到平台去的习惯。
data.enText: The women had got into the way of going up on the deck every evening.
get in the way of

data.chText: 挡…的路；妨碍
data.enText: to prevent sb from doing sth; to prevent sth from happening

data.chText: 他不会让情绪妨碍自己的工作。
data.enText: He wouldn't allow emotions to get in the way of him doing his job.
get/have your own way

data.chText: 一意孤行；为所欲为
data.enText: to get or do what you want, especially when sb has tried to stop you

data.chText: 到最后总是她说了算。
data.enText: She always gets her own way in the end.
give way

data.chText: 断裂；倒塌；塌陷
data.enText: to break or fall down

data.chText: 这些立柱坍塌了，一部分屋顶坠落下来。
data.enText: The pillars gave way and a section of the roof collapsed.

data.chText: 她那麻木了的腿一软，她便重重地摔了一跤。
data.enText: Her numb leg gave way beneath her and she stumbled clumsily.
give way (to sb/sth)

data.chText: 屈服；退让；让步
data.enText: to stop resisting sb/sth; to agree to do sth that you do not want to do

data.chText: 他拒绝在任何一点上让步。
data.enText: He refused to give way on any of the points.

data.chText: 让…在先；让…先行
data.enText: to allow sb/sth to be or go first

data.chText: 让已上环状交叉路的车辆先行。
data.enText: Give way to traffic already on the roundabout.
give way to sth

data.chText: 让自己陷于（某种情绪等）
data.enText: to allow yourself to be very strongly affected by sth, especially an emotion

data.chText: 她一头扑倒在床上，痛苦不堪。
data.enText: Flinging herself on the bed, she gave way to helpless misery.

data.chText: 被…代替
data.enText: to be replaced by sth

data.chText: 暴风雨过后阳光灿烂。
data.enText: The storm gave way to bright sunshine.
go all the way (with sb)

data.chText: （与某人）尽情地性交
data.enText: to have full sexual intercourse with sb
go a long/some way towards doing sth

data.chText: （对做某事）帮助很大 / 不大，作用很大 / 不大
data.enText: to help very much/a little in achieving sth

data.chText: 新的法律十分有助于解决这一问题。
data.enText: The new law goes a long way towards solving the problem.
go out of your way (to do sth)

data.chText: 特地；格外努力
data.enText: to make a special effort to do sth

data.chText: 他总是特意向她表示友好。
data.enText: He would always go out of his way to be friendly towards her.
go your own way

data.chText: 一意孤行；我行我素
data.enText: to do as you choose, especially when sb has advised you against it

data.chText: 你要不想吵架的话，最好是随她去好了。
data.enText: It's best to let her go her own way if you don't want a fight.
go sb's way

data.chText: 与…同路
data.enText: to travel in the same direction as sb

data.chText: 咱们同路，我和你一起走。
data.enText: I'm going your way─I'll walk with you.

data.chText: 进行顺利；对…有利
data.enText: to go well for you; to be in your favour

data.chText: 拳击打到第三回合，他知道形势对自己很有利。
data.enText: By the third round he knew the fight was going his way.
go the way of all flesh

data.chText: 长逝；走向人生终点
data.enText: to die
have it your own way!

data.chText: 随你的便好了
data.enText: used to say in an angry way that although you are not happy about sth that sb has said, you are not going to argue

data.chText: 啊，好啦。随你的便吧。
data.enText: Oh OK, then. Have it your own way.
have it/things/everything your own way

data.chText: 为所欲为；一意孤行
data.enText: to have what you want, especially by opposing other people
have a way of doing sth

data.chText: …是常有的事（尤指无法控制的事）
data.enText: used to say that sth often happens in a particular way, especially when it is out of your control

data.chText: 第一次恋爱常常不成功。
data.enText: First love affairs have a way of not working out.
have a way with sb/sth

data.chText: 善于应付；善于处理；有办法对付
data.enText: to be good at dealing with sb/sth

data.chText: 他很会逗小孩。
data.enText: He has a way with small children.

data.chText: 她善于辞令。
data.enText: She has a way with words (= is very good at expressing herself) .
have/want it both ways

data.chText: （想）两全其美
data.enText: to have or want to have the advantages of two different situations or ways of behaving that are impossible to combine

data.chText: 你不可能做到两全其美。如果你有钱整天外出玩乐，就能还掉一部分债。
data.enText: You can't have it both ways. If you can afford to go out all the time, you can afford to pay off some of your debts.
have your (wicked) way with sb

data.chText: 把…勾到手
data.enText: to persuade sb to have sex with you
in a big/small way

data.chText: 大 / 小规模地
data.enText: on a large/small scale

data.chText: 新的递送服务迅速走红。
data.enText: The new delivery service has taken off in a big way.

data.chText: 许多人都在小量地向证券市场投资。
data.enText: Many people are investing in a small way in the stock market.
in more ways than one

data.chText: （所说的话）不止一个意思；在很多方面
data.enText: used to show that a statement has more than one meaning

data.chText: 他进第一个球时从多方面动了脑筋。
data.enText: With the first goal he used his head in more ways than one.
in her, his, its, etc. (own) way

data.chText: 以…的特有方式
data.enText: in a manner that is appropriate to or typical of a person or thing but that may seem unusual to other people

data.chText: 我想她的确是以她特有的方式爱你。
data.enText: I expect she does love you in her own way.
in a way
in one way
in some ways

data.chText: 在某种程度上；不完全地
data.enText: to some extent; not completely

data.chText: 从某种意义上来说，这是我们所犯的最大错误之一。
data.enText: In a way it was one of our biggest mistakes.
in the/sb's way

data.chText: 妨碍；挡着…的路
data.enText: stopping sb from moving or doing sth

data.chText: 你得挪一挪，你挡了我的路。
data.enText: You'll have to move─you're in my way.

data.chText: 我留下他们单独在一起，因为我觉得我碍他们的事。
data.enText: I left them alone, as I felt I was in the way.
in the way of sth

data.chText: （用于问句或否定句）关于，就…而言
data.enText: used in questions and negative sentences to talk about the types of sth that are available

data.chText: 这个地方没有多少娱乐活动。
data.enText: There isn't much in the way of entertainment in this place.
keep/stay out of sb's way

data.chText: 规避；避开；躲开
data.enText: to avoid sb
look the other way

data.chText: 故意避而不看
data.enText: to deliberately avoid seeing sb/sth

data.chText: 狱警知道出了什么事，但扭过头去装作没看见。
data.enText: Prison officers know what's going on, but look the other way.
lose your way

data.chText: 迷失方向；迷路
data.enText: to become lost

data.chText: 我们在黑暗中迷了路。
data.enText: We lost our way in the dark.

data.chText: 忘记宗旨；背离…的意图
data.enText: to forget or move away from the purpose or reason for sth

data.chText: 我觉得这个项目已经背离了原来的意图。
data.enText: I feel that the project has lost its way.
make your way (to/towards sth)

data.chText: 去；前往；到…地方去；前进
data.enText: to move or get somewhere; to make progress

data.chText: 你能自己去机场吗？
data.enText: Will you be able to make your own way to the airport (= get there without help, a ride, etc.) ?

data.chText: 这就是你要出人头地的计划吗？
data.enText: Is this your plan for making your way in the world ?
make way (for sb/sth)

data.chText: 让…通过；给…让路；让出位置
data.enText: to allow sb/sth to pass; to allow sb/sth to take the place of sb/sth

data.chText: 给市长大人让路！
data.enText: Make way for the Lord Mayor!

data.chText: 热带森林被砍伐，腾出地方做草地。
data.enText: Tropical forest is felled to make way for grassland.
my way or the highway

data.chText: 要么听我的，要么走人
data.enText: used to say that sb else has either to agree with your opinion or to leave
(there are) no two ways about it

data.chText: 肯定无疑；别无他途
data.enText: used to show that you are certain about sth

data.chText: 这是错误的决定，毫无疑问。
data.enText: It was the wrong decision─there are no two ways about it.
(there is) no way

data.chText: 不可能；决不；不行；没门儿
data.enText: used to say that there is no possibility that you will do sth or that sth will happen

data.chText: “你想帮忙吗？”“没门！”
data.enText: ‘Do you want to help?’ ‘No way!’

data.chText: 我无论如何都不会开车把他们送到那里去。
data.enText: No way am I going to drive them there.

data.chText: 我们无论如何都花不起那种钱。
data.enText: There's no way we could afford that sort of money.
on your/the/its way

data.chText: 即将去（或来）；就要去（或来）
data.enText: going or coming

data.chText: 我最好还是快点儿走。
data.enText: I'd better be on my way (= I must leave) soon.

data.chText: 那封信该在路上了。
data.enText: The letter should be on its way to you.

data.chText: 在路上；在行进中
data.enText: during the journey

data.chText: 他中途停下吃早点。
data.enText: He stopped for breakfast on the way.

data.chText: 她出门时一把抓起照相机和提包。
data.enText: She grabbed her camera and bag on her way out.

data.chText: 尚未出生的
data.enText: not yet born

data.chText: 他们有三个孩子，还有一个尚未出生。
data.enText: They've got three kids and one on the way.
the other way round

data.chText: 颠倒过来；相反；反过来
data.enText: in the opposite position, direction or order

data.chText: 我想这应该以相反的方式继续下去。
data.enText: I think it should go on the other way round.

data.chText: 相反的情况
data.enText: the opposite situation

data.chText: 我没有离开你。是你离开了我。
data.enText: I didn't leave you. It was the other way round (= you left me) .
out of the way

data.chText: 不再挡路；不再碍事
data.enText: no longer stopping sb from moving or doing sth

data.chText: 我挪开腿让她过去。
data.enText: I moved my legs out of the way so that she could get past.

data.chText: 我直到爸爸走开之后才说话。
data.enText: I didn't say anything until Dad was out of the way.

data.chText: 结束；处理完
data.enText: finished; dealt with

data.chText: 大选一结束，我们地区就准备发展。
data.enText: Our region is poised for growth once the election is out of the way.

data.chText: （用于否定句）奇特的，不寻常的，罕见的
data.enText: used in negative sentences to mean ‘unusual’

data.chText: 她显然没发现异常情况。
data.enText: She had obviously noticed nothing out of the way.
out of your way

data.chText: 不在计划走的路线上
data.enText: not on the route that you planned to take

data.chText: 我很想搭你的车回家，如果这不叫你绕路的话。
data.enText: I'd love a ride home─if it's not out of your way.
see your way (clear) to doing sth/to do sth

data.chText: 觉得有可能做某事；认为便于做某事
data.enText: to find that it is possible or convenient to do sth

data.chText: 小建筑商认为不可能招收很多见习生。
data.enText: Small builders cannot see their way clear to take on many trainees.
see which way the wind is blowing

data.chText: 看看风向；观察势头；摸清可能发生的情况
data.enText: to get an idea of what is likely to happen before doing sth
(not) stand in sb's way

data.chText: （不）妨碍别人
data.enText: to (not) prevent sb from doing sth

data.chText: 如果你相信你能使她幸福，我不会妨碍你的。
data.enText: If you believe you can make her happy, I won't stand in your way.
that's the way the cookie crumbles

data.chText: 情况就是这样；没有别的办法
data.enText: that is the situation and we cannot change it, so we must accept it
there's more than one way to skin a cat

data.chText: （要做成某事）方法不止一个，有的是办法
data.enText: there are many different ways to achieve sth
to my way of thinking

data.chText: 我认为；依我看；依我之见
data.enText: in my opinion
under way
underway

data.chText: 已经开始；在进行中
data.enText: having started

data.chText: 五月份特别活动周的准备工作已经顺利开展。
data.enText: Preparations are well under way for a week of special events in May.
a/the/sb's way of life

data.chText: （个人或群体的）特有的行为模式，典型生活方式
data.enText: the typical pattern of behaviour of a person or group

data.chText: 美国人的生活方式
data.enText: the American way of life
the way of the world

data.chText: 大多数人的行为模式；世道；事情发生的规律
data.enText: the way that most people behave; the way that things happen, which you cannot change

data.chText: 有钱有势者说了算，这就是世道。
data.enText: The rich and powerful make the decisions─that's the way of the world.
ways and means

data.chText: （做某事现有的）方法和资源，手段和财力
data.enText: the methods and materials available for doing sth

data.chText: 筹资办法
data.enText: ways and means of raising money
a way into sth
a way in to sth

data.chText: （加入难以进入的群体、行业等的）敲门砖；（弄懂难以理解事物的）窍门，诀窍
data.enText: something that allows you to join a group of people, an industry, etc. that it is difficult to join, or to understand sth that it is difficult to understand
the way to sb's heart

data.chText: 赢得某人喜爱的办法；攻心策
data.enText: the way to make sb like or love you

data.chText: 取得男人欢心的方法就是让他吃好。
data.enText: The way to a man's heart is through his stomach (= by giving him good food) .
way to go!

data.chText: 干得好
data.enText: used to tell sb that you are pleased about sth they have done

data.chText: 伙计们，活儿不错！干得好！
data.enText: Good work, guys! Way to go!
work your way through college, round the world, etc.

data.chText: 勤工俭学；半工半读；边挣钱边周游世界
data.enText: to have a job or series of jobs while studying, travelling, etc. in order to pay for your education, etc.
work your way through sth

data.chText: 自始至终做（尤指耗费时间或力量的事）
data.enText: to do sth from beginning to end, especially when it takes a lot of time or effort

data.chText: 她从头至尾处理了那一堆文件。
data.enText: She worked her way through the pile of documents.
work your way up

data.chText: 逐步升职；按部就班晋升
data.enText: to move regularly to a more senior position in a company

data.chText: 他从送信员一步一步晋升为客户经理。
data.enText: He worked his way up from messenger boy to account executive.
change your ways

data.chText: 开始过另一种生活；换个活法
data.enText: to start to live or behave in a different way from before
claw your way back, into sth, out of sth, to sth, etc.

data.chText: 努力逐步获得；艰难地移动
data.enText: to gradually achieve sth or move somewhere by using a lot of determination and effort

data.chText: 她拼死拼活地爬到了她职业的顶峰。
data.enText: She clawed her way to the top of her profession.

data.chText: 他艰难地从倒塌的大楼废墟底下慢慢爬了出来。
data.enText: Slowly, he clawed his way out from under the collapsed building.
clear the way (for sth/for sth to happen)

data.chText: （为…）清除障碍，扫清道路
data.enText: to remove things that are stopping the progress or movement of sth

data.chText: 这项裁决也许能为引渡程序铺平道路。
data.enText: The ruling could clear the way for extradition proceedings.
be (all) downhill
be downhill all the way

data.chText: （与前面的相比较）容易
data.enText: to be easy compared to what came before

data.chText: 从这以后就容易了。我们很快就会结束。
data.enText: It's all downhill from here. We'll soon be finished.

data.chText: 每况愈下；走下坡路；不断恶化
data.enText: to become worse or less successful

data.chText: 从那时起他的战绩便江河日下，五场比赛输掉了四场。
data.enText: It's been all downhill for his career since then, with four defeats in five games.

data.chText: 我开始当记者后，身体每况愈下。
data.enText: I started work as a journalist and it was downhill all the way for my health.
take the easy way out

data.chText: 以最简单的方法解决难题；快刀斩乱麻
data.enText: to end a difficult situation by choosing the simplest solution even if it is not the best one
see, realize, etc. the error of your ways

data.chText: 知过即改；承认自己的做法不对并决心改正

data.enText: or
to realize or admit that you have done sth wrong and decide to change your behaviour
(be/get) in the family way

data.chText: 怀孕；有喜
data.enText: (to be/become) pregnant
feel your way

data.chText: （如在黑暗中）摸索着走动
data.enText: to move along carefully, for example when it is dark, by touching walls, objects, etc.

data.chText: （在新环境中）谨慎行事
data.enText: to be careful about how you do things, usually because you are in a situation that you are not familiar with

data.chText: 她对这项工作不熟悉，还在摸索着干。
data.enText: She was new in the job, still feeling her way.
find your way (to…)

data.chText: 找到正确的路（去某处）
data.enText: to discover the right route (to a place)

data.chText: 希望你能找到回家的路。
data.enText: I hope you can find your way home.
the hard way

data.chText: 通过痛苦的经历；通过出错
data.enText: by having an unpleasant experience or by making mistakes

data.chText: 她不肯听我的忠告，所以只好吃了苦头才知道厉害。
data.enText: She won't listen to my advice so she'll just have to learn the hard way .
out of harm's way

data.chText: 在安全的地方；被隔离
data.enText: in a safe place where sb/sth cannot be hurt or injured or do any damage to sb/sth
have your head screwed on (the right way)

data.chText: 头脑清醒；理智
data.enText: to be a sensible person
know your way around

data.chText: 熟悉周围情况（或课题等）
data.enText: to be familiar with a place, subject, etc.
laugh all the way to the bank

data.chText: 发大财而喜笑颜开
data.enText: to make a lot of money easily and feel very pleased about it
lie your way into/out of sth

data.chText: 由于撒谎而处于某种境地（或摆脱某种处境）
data.enText: to get yourself into or out of a situation by lying
by a long way

data.chText: 大量地；大大地
data.enText: by a great amount
mend your ways

data.chText: 改过自新；改邪归正
data.enText: to stop behaving badly
(steer, take, etc.) a middle course
(find, etc.) a/the middle way

data.chText: （走）中间道路；（取）中庸之道；（采取）折中办法
data.enText: (to take/find) an acceptable course of action that avoids two extreme positions
open the way for sb/sth (to do sth)

data.chText: 开方便之门
data.enText: to make it possible for sb to do sth or for sth to happen
in the ordinary way

data.chText: 一般地；通常地
data.enText: used to say what normally happens in a particular situation

data.chText: 一般而言，她是个不爱紧张的人。
data.enText: In the ordinary way, she's not a nervous person.
a/the parting of the ways

data.chText: 岔路口；分道扬镳处；分手时刻
data.enText: a point at which two people or groups of people decide to separate
pave the way (for sb/sth)

data.chText: （为…）铺平道路，创造条件
data.enText: to create a situation in which sb will be able to do sth or sth can happen

data.chText: 这项决议为修改妇女就业权利创造了条件。
data.enText: This decision paved the way for changes in employment rights for women.
pay its way

data.chText: 赢利运作；不负债；收支平衡
data.enText: to make enough money to pay what it costs to keep it going

data.chText: 这座桥现在还入不敷出。
data.enText: The bridge is still not paying its way.
pick your way (across, along, among, over, through sth)

data.chText: 择路而行；小心看着路行走
data.enText: to walk carefully, choosing the safest, driest, etc. place to put your feet

data.chText: 她小心翼翼地在高低不平的地面上行走。
data.enText: She picked her way delicately over the rough ground.
rub sb up the wrong way
rub sb the wrong way

data.chText: （无意中）惹人生气，触怒别人
data.enText: to make sb annoyed or angry, often without intending to, by doing or saying sth that offends them
go your separate ways

data.chText: 断绝往来；分道扬镳
data.enText: to end a relationship with sb

data.chText: 分路而行；分手
data.enText: to go in a different direction from sb you have been travelling with
in any (way,) shape or form

data.chText: 任何形式
data.enText: of any type

data.chText: 我不赞成任何形式的暴力行为。
data.enText: I don't approve of violence in any shape or form.
show the way

data.chText: 示范
data.enText: to do sth first so that other people can follow
smooth the path/way

data.chText: 铺平道路
data.enText: to make it easier for sb/sth to develop or make progress

data.chText: 这些谈判目的在于为签订和平条约铺平道路。
data.enText: These negotiations are intended to smooth the path to a peace treaty.
in your own sweet time/way

data.chText: 任凭自己的意愿
data.enText: how and when you want to, even though this might annoy other people

data.chText: 工作他总是在做，但只在自己高兴的时候做。
data.enText: He always does the work, but in his own sweet time.
swing both ways

data.chText: 双性恋；既喜欢异性也喜欢同性
data.enText: to be bisexual (= sexually attracted to both men and women)
talk your way out of sth/of doing sth

data.chText: 靠能言善辩开脱；以话解围
data.enText: to make excuses and give reasons for not doing sth; to manage to get yourself out of a difficult situation

data.chText: 我好说歹说总算逃脱了发言差事。
data.enText: I managed to talk my way out of having to give a speech.
be well on the way to sth/doing sth

data.chText: 即将达到；将要成就
data.enText: to have nearly achieved sth and be going to achieve it soon

data.chText: 她就要康复了。
data.enText: She is well on the way to recovery.

data.chText: 他很快就会成为排名世界前十位的选手。
data.enText: He is well on the way to establishing himself among the top ten players in the world.
where there's a will there's a way

data.chText: 有志者事竟成
data.enText: if you really want to do sth then you will find a way of doing it
take sth the wrong way

data.chText: 误会本意良好的话
data.enText: to be offended by a remark that was not intended to be offensive

data.chText: 很远；大量

before.enText: used with a preposition or an adverb

data.enText: very far; by a large amount

data.chText: 她遥遥领先于其他选手跑到终点。
data.enText: She finished the race way ahead of the other runners.

data.chText: 我得回家了，早过了我的就寝时间了。
data.enText: I must be going home; it's way past my bedtime.

data.chText: 这价格大大超过了我们的支付能力。
data.enText: The price is way above what we can afford.

data.chText: 他们住在很偏远的郊区。
data.enText: They live way out in the suburbs.

data.chText: 这条裙子太短了。
data.enText: This skirt is way (= a lot) too short.

data.chText: 我估计那里会有一百人，但是我大错特错了。
data.enText: I guessed that there would be a hundred people there, but I was way out (= wrong by a large amount).
way back (in…)

data.chText: 很久以前
data.enText: a long time ago

data.chText: 我和他初次见面早在1980年代。
data.enText: I first met him way back in the 80s.

word_means: 行为方式，生活方式，习俗

means: (群体的)行为方式，生活方式，习俗

ex.chText: 公路
ex.enText: highway

ex.chText: 高速公路
ex.enText: motorway

ex.chText: 铁路
ex.enText: railway

ex.chText: 他问路人去邮局的路。
ex.enText: He asked a passer-by the way to the post office.

ex.chText: 有一辆卡车挡住了路。
ex.enText: There was a truck blocking the way.

ex.chText: 这是通往那个小村庄的道路。
ex.enText: This is the way to the small village.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，含义广泛，可指任何形式的路，也常和其他词构成复合词。

ex.chText: 我的地址是：美国纽约第5大街211号。
ex.enText: My address is 211, Ave. 5, New York, USA.

ex.chText: 人们喜欢沿巴黎的大街散步。
ex.enText: People love to walk down the avenues of Paris.

ex.chText: 她喜欢沿着林阴道散步。
ex.enText: She likes to walk along the avenue.

synonyms.bx: 指城镇中长而宽的大街，通常为南北走向；英国英语中则指通向大房子的林阴道。

ex.chText: 车道两边是两行大树。
ex.enText: There are two lines of big trees on both sides of the drive.

ex.chText: 他把送货车停在小别墅的私人车道上。
ex.enText: He pulled up the delivery van at the cottage drive.

ex.chText: 我们不能把车停在这条私人车道上。
ex.enText: We can't park the car on this drive.

synonyms.bx: 指连接私人住宅与外部街道的车道，通常专供私人车辆通行。

ex.chText: 离开那个镇子的公路有两条。
ex.enText: There are two highways out of the town.

ex.chText: 这条公路与那条铁路平行。
ex.enText: The highway runs parallel with the railway.

synonyms.bx: 指连接两个城镇的主干道。

ex.chText: 由于大雾，高速公路关闭了。
ex.enText: The motorway has been closed due to the thick fog.

ex.chText: 沿着高速公路可以看到很多警示牌。
ex.enText: You can see many warning signs along the motorway.

synonyms.bx: 尤指城市之间的高速公路。

ex.chText: 你注意到草地上那条被踩得坑坑洼洼的小径了吗？
ex.enText: Have you noticed the well-worn path across the grass?

ex.chText: 他们顺着小路来到那个村子。
ex.enText: They followed the path to the village.

ex.chText: 我们沿着小路行走，欣赏着自然风光。
ex.enText: We walked along the path, enjoying the natural scenery.

ex.chText: 他们只得在丛林中开出一条小路。
ex.enText: They had to cut out a path through the jungle.

synonyms.bx: 通常指小道、小路、小径，特别是田间、林间常由人或牲畜走出来的小径。

ex.chText: 这条路是上周正式通车的。
ex.enText: This road was formally opened last week.

ex.chText: 过马路的时候再小心也不为过。
ex.enText: You cannot be too careful while crossing the road.

ex.chText: 在人行道上走要比在马路中间走安全。
ex.enText: It's safer to walk on the pavement than in the road.

ex.chText: 那个女人在结冰的路上滑了一跤，摔断了腿。
ex.enText: The woman slipped on the icy road and broke her leg.

synonyms.bx: 词义广泛，多指供车辆、行人或马匹等使用的平坦大道，也指旁边有建筑物的街道。

ex.chText: 我们已选定了要走的路线。
ex.enText: We've decided on the route to take.

ex.chText: 你进城最好走这条道。
ex.enText: You'd better take this route to town.

ex.chText: 这是去底特律最快的路线。
ex.enText: It's the quickest route to Detroit.

ex.chText: 专机没有按通常的商业航线飞行。
ex.enText: The special plane did not fly the usual commercial route.

synonyms.bx: 指从某处到另一处的路线，或公共汽车、火车、轮船、飞机等的固定路线或航线。

ex.chText: 你去过这条商业街吗？
ex.enText: Have you ever been to this shopping street?

ex.chText: 这里曾经是一条安静的居民街。
ex.enText: This used to be a quiet residential street.

synonyms.bx: 指城镇中的道路，其一侧或两侧通常有房屋、商店等建筑物。

ex.chText: 他的教学方法很传统。
ex.enText: His teaching method is quite traditional.

ex.chText: 这是中国学生学好英语的一种有效的方法。
ex.enText: This is an effective method for Chinese students to learn English well.

synonyms.bx: 指有计划地做某事的方法，尤指很多人都知道并使用的方法。

ex.chText: 他的新英语教学法很受学生欢迎。
ex.enText: His new approach to teaching English was very popular among the students.

ex.chText: 你为什么不采用传统的艺术评论方法呢？
ex.enText: Why don't you take a traditional approach to art criticism?

synonyms.bx: 指行事或处理问题的方法，常后接介词 to 。

ex.chText: 他像往常那样结束了讲话。
ex.enText: He finished the speech in his usual manner.

ex.chText: 他以这种方式死去，使得该事件更加复杂了。
ex.enText: The manner of his death made the matter more complicated.

synonyms.bx: 指做某事或某事发生的方式，通常只用单数。

ex.chText: 这是他们唯一的交流方式。
ex.enText: This is their only means of communication.

ex.chText: 体罚不应该作为约束儿童的手段。
ex.enText: Physical punishment should not be used as a means of controlling children.

synonyms.bx: 指做某事或为达到某种目的而采用的方法或手段。

ex.chText: 他们有不同的思维方式。
ex.enText: They have different modes of thought.

ex.chText: 她当时期待着过一种悠闲的生活。
ex.enText: She was looking forward to a relaxed mode of life.

synonyms.bx: 指行为、生活或做某事的方式，多因习惯、传统或习俗而形成，有时含刻板之意。

ex.chText: 你处理这个问题的方式是什么？
ex.enText: What is your way to tackle this problem?

ex.chText: 游泳是减肥的一种方式。
ex.enText: Swimming is one way to lose weight.

ex.chText: 他用他自己的方式爱她。
ex.enText: He loved her in his own way.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，可指做某事或达成某事的方法，也可指某事发生的方式。

data.enText: across the way
over the way

data.chText: 在街对面；在…对面
data.enText: on the other side of the street, etc.

data.chText: 从街对面那栋房子开着的窗户里传出嘈杂的音乐声。
data.enText: Music blared from the open window of the house across the way.
all the way
the whole way

data.chText: 一路上；自始至终
data.enText: during the whole journey/period of time

data.chText: 回家的一路上，她没对我说过一句话。
data.enText: She didn't speak a word to me all the way back home.

data.chText: 完全地；无保留地
data.enText: completely; as much as it takes to achieve what you want

data.chText: 我在全力和他对抗。
data.enText: I'm fighting him all the way.

data.chText: 你可以感觉到听众完全支持她。
data.enText: You can feel that the audience is with her all the way.
(that's/it's) always the way

data.chText: （表示经常如此，尤用于贬义）总是这样，老是
data.enText: used to say that things often happen in a particular way, especially when it is not convenient
any way you slice it

data.chText: 无论你如何看待
data.enText: however you choose to look at a situation
be/be born/be made that way

data.chText: 天性如此；生下就这样
data.enText: to behave or do things in a particular manner because it is part of your character

data.chText: 他如此自命不凡并不是他的错，他天生就是这种性格。
data.enText: It's not his fault he's so pompous─he was born that way.
be set in your ways

data.chText: 积习难改；秉性难移；执拗
data.enText: to have habits or opinions that you have had for a long time and that you do not want to change
by the way

data.chText: 顺便提一下；捎带说一声；附带问一句
data.enText: used to introduce a comment or question that is not directly related to what you have been talking about

data.chText: 顺便提一下，我找到了你在寻找的那本书。
data.enText: By the way, I found that book you were looking for.

data.chText: 顺便问一句，几点钟了？
data.enText: What's the time, by the way?

data.chText: 啊，对了，你要是看到杰基，告诉她我今晚给她打电话。
data.enText: Oh by the way, if you see Jackie, tell her I'll call her this evening.
by way of sth

data.chText: 路经；经过；经由
data.enText: by a route that includes the place mentioned

data.chText: 这位艺术家最近从保加利亚途经维也纳到了巴黎。
data.enText: The artist recently arrived in Paris from Bulgaria by way of Vienna.

data.chText: 她是念过戏剧学校后到电视台的。
data.enText: She came to TV by way of drama school.
by way of/in the way of sth

data.chText: 作为…的形式；为了；作为…的手段
data.enText: as a form of sth; for sth; as a means of sth

data.chText: 他得到那家公司600英镑的赔偿。
data.enText: He received £600 by way of compensation from the company.

data.chText: 她转动了一下眼睛作为回答就走了。
data.enText: She rolled her eyes by way of an answer and left.
come your way

data.chText: 意外落在…头上；偶尔发生在…身上
data.enText: to happen to you by chance, or when you were not expecting it

data.chText: 无论什么事落到他的头上，他都认了。
data.enText: He took whatever came his way.
cut both/two ways

data.chText: 两面都行得通（或说得通）；有利也有弊
data.enText: to have two opposite effects or results
either way
one way or the other

data.chText: 两者都一样
data.enText: used to say that it does not matter which one of two possibilities happens, is chosen or is true

data.chText: 是他的错或不是？无论是不是，都得有个解释。
data.enText: Was it his fault or not? Either way, an explanation is due.

data.chText: 我们可以在今天或明天见面，哪一天对我都行。
data.enText: We could meet today or tomorrow─I don't mind one way or the other.
every which way

data.chText: 四面八方；向各处
data.enText: in all directions

data.chText: 她的头发乱得像鸡窝。
data.enText: Her hair tumbled every which way.
get into/out of the way of (doing) sth

data.chText: 养成（或丢掉）…的习惯
data.enText: to become used to doing sth/to lose the habit of doing sth

data.chText: 这些女人养成了每天晚上到平台去的习惯。
data.enText: The women had got into the way of going up on the deck every evening.
get in the way of

data.chText: 挡…的路；妨碍
data.enText: to prevent sb from doing sth; to prevent sth from happening

data.chText: 他不会让情绪妨碍自己的工作。
data.enText: He wouldn't allow emotions to get in the way of him doing his job.
get/have your own way

data.chText: 一意孤行；为所欲为
data.enText: to get or do what you want, especially when sb has tried to stop you

data.chText: 到最后总是她说了算。
data.enText: She always gets her own way in the end.
give way

data.chText: 断裂；倒塌；塌陷
data.enText: to break or fall down

data.chText: 这些立柱坍塌了，一部分屋顶坠落下来。
data.enText: The pillars gave way and a section of the roof collapsed.

data.chText: 她那麻木了的腿一软，她便重重地摔了一跤。
data.enText: Her numb leg gave way beneath her and she stumbled clumsily.
give way (to sb/sth)

data.chText: 屈服；退让；让步
data.enText: to stop resisting sb/sth; to agree to do sth that you do not want to do

data.chText: 他拒绝在任何一点上让步。
data.enText: He refused to give way on any of the points.

data.chText: 让…在先；让…先行
data.enText: to allow sb/sth to be or go first

data.chText: 让已上环状交叉路的车辆先行。
data.enText: Give way to traffic already on the roundabout.
give way to sth

data.chText: 让自己陷于（某种情绪等）
data.enText: to allow yourself to be very strongly affected by sth, especially an emotion

data.chText: 她一头扑倒在床上，痛苦不堪。
data.enText: Flinging herself on the bed, she gave way to helpless misery.

data.chText: 被…代替
data.enText: to be replaced by sth

data.chText: 暴风雨过后阳光灿烂。
data.enText: The storm gave way to bright sunshine.
go all the way (with sb)

data.chText: （与某人）尽情地性交
data.enText: to have full sexual intercourse with sb
go a long/some way towards doing sth

data.chText: （对做某事）帮助很大 / 不大，作用很大 / 不大
data.enText: to help very much/a little in achieving sth

data.chText: 新的法律十分有助于解决这一问题。
data.enText: The new law goes a long way towards solving the problem.
go out of your way (to do sth)

data.chText: 特地；格外努力
data.enText: to make a special effort to do sth

data.chText: 他总是特意向她表示友好。
data.enText: He would always go out of his way to be friendly towards her.
go your own way

data.chText: 一意孤行；我行我素
data.enText: to do as you choose, especially when sb has advised you against it

data.chText: 你要不想吵架的话，最好是随她去好了。
data.enText: It's best to let her go her own way if you don't want a fight.
go sb's way

data.chText: 与…同路
data.enText: to travel in the same direction as sb

data.chText: 咱们同路，我和你一起走。
data.enText: I'm going your way─I'll walk with you.

data.chText: 进行顺利；对…有利
data.enText: to go well for you; to be in your favour

data.chText: 拳击打到第三回合，他知道形势对自己很有利。
data.enText: By the third round he knew the fight was going his way.
go the way of all flesh

data.chText: 长逝；走向人生终点
data.enText: to die
have it your own way!

data.chText: 随你的便好了
data.enText: used to say in an angry way that although you are not happy about sth that sb has said, you are not going to argue

data.chText: 啊，好啦。随你的便吧。
data.enText: Oh OK, then. Have it your own way.
have it/things/everything your own way

data.chText: 为所欲为；一意孤行
data.enText: to have what you want, especially by opposing other people
have a way of doing sth

data.chText: …是常有的事（尤指无法控制的事）
data.enText: used to say that sth often happens in a particular way, especially when it is out of your control

data.chText: 第一次恋爱常常不成功。
data.enText: First love affairs have a way of not working out.
have a way with sb/sth

data.chText: 善于应付；善于处理；有办法对付
data.enText: to be good at dealing with sb/sth

data.chText: 他很会逗小孩。
data.enText: He has a way with small children.

data.chText: 她善于辞令。
data.enText: She has a way with words (= is very good at expressing herself) .
have/want it both ways

data.chText: （想）两全其美
data.enText: to have or want to have the advantages of two different situations or ways of behaving that are impossible to combine

data.chText: 你不可能做到两全其美。如果你有钱整天外出玩乐，就能还掉一部分债。
data.enText: You can't have it both ways. If you can afford to go out all the time, you can afford to pay off some of your debts.
have your (wicked) way with sb

data.chText: 把…勾到手
data.enText: to persuade sb to have sex with you
in a big/small way

data.chText: 大 / 小规模地
data.enText: on a large/small scale

data.chText: 新的递送服务迅速走红。
data.enText: The new delivery service has taken off in a big way.

data.chText: 许多人都在小量地向证券市场投资。
data.enText: Many people are investing in a small way in the stock market.
in more ways than one

data.chText: （所说的话）不止一个意思；在很多方面
data.enText: used to show that a statement has more than one meaning

data.chText: 他进第一个球时从多方面动了脑筋。
data.enText: With the first goal he used his head in more ways than one.
in her, his, its, etc. (own) way

data.chText: 以…的特有方式
data.enText: in a manner that is appropriate to or typical of a person or thing but that may seem unusual to other people

data.chText: 我想她的确是以她特有的方式爱你。
data.enText: I expect she does love you in her own way.
in a way
in one way
in some ways

data.chText: 在某种程度上；不完全地
data.enText: to some extent; not completely

data.chText: 从某种意义上来说，这是我们所犯的最大错误之一。
data.enText: In a way it was one of our biggest mistakes.
in the/sb's way

data.chText: 妨碍；挡着…的路
data.enText: stopping sb from moving or doing sth

data.chText: 你得挪一挪，你挡了我的路。
data.enText: You'll have to move─you're in my way.

data.chText: 我留下他们单独在一起，因为我觉得我碍他们的事。
data.enText: I left them alone, as I felt I was in the way.
in the way of sth

data.chText: （用于问句或否定句）关于，就…而言
data.enText: used in questions and negative sentences to talk about the types of sth that are available

data.chText: 这个地方没有多少娱乐活动。
data.enText: There isn't much in the way of entertainment in this place.
keep/stay out of sb's way

data.chText: 规避；避开；躲开
data.enText: to avoid sb
look the other way

data.chText: 故意避而不看
data.enText: to deliberately avoid seeing sb/sth

data.chText: 狱警知道出了什么事，但扭过头去装作没看见。
data.enText: Prison officers know what's going on, but look the other way.
lose your way

data.chText: 迷失方向；迷路
data.enText: to become lost

data.chText: 我们在黑暗中迷了路。
data.enText: We lost our way in the dark.

data.chText: 忘记宗旨；背离…的意图
data.enText: to forget or move away from the purpose or reason for sth

data.chText: 我觉得这个项目已经背离了原来的意图。
data.enText: I feel that the project has lost its way.
make your way (to/towards sth)

data.chText: 去；前往；到…地方去；前进
data.enText: to move or get somewhere; to make progress

data.chText: 你能自己去机场吗？
data.enText: Will you be able to make your own way to the airport (= get there without help, a ride, etc.) ?

data.chText: 这就是你要出人头地的计划吗？
data.enText: Is this your plan for making your way in the world ?
make way (for sb/sth)

data.chText: 让…通过；给…让路；让出位置
data.enText: to allow sb/sth to pass; to allow sb/sth to take the place of sb/sth

data.chText: 给市长大人让路！
data.enText: Make way for the Lord Mayor!

data.chText: 热带森林被砍伐，腾出地方做草地。
data.enText: Tropical forest is felled to make way for grassland.
my way or the highway

data.chText: 要么听我的，要么走人
data.enText: used to say that sb else has either to agree with your opinion or to leave
(there are) no two ways about it

data.chText: 肯定无疑；别无他途
data.enText: used to show that you are certain about sth

data.chText: 这是错误的决定，毫无疑问。
data.enText: It was the wrong decision─there are no two ways about it.
(there is) no way

data.chText: 不可能；决不；不行；没门儿
data.enText: used to say that there is no possibility that you will do sth or that sth will happen

data.chText: “你想帮忙吗？”“没门！”
data.enText: ‘Do you want to help?’ ‘No way!’

data.chText: 我无论如何都不会开车把他们送到那里去。
data.enText: No way am I going to drive them there.

data.chText: 我们无论如何都花不起那种钱。
data.enText: There's no way we could afford that sort of money.
on your/the/its way

data.chText: 即将去（或来）；就要去（或来）
data.enText: going or coming

data.chText: 我最好还是快点儿走。
data.enText: I'd better be on my way (= I must leave) soon.

data.chText: 那封信该在路上了。
data.enText: The letter should be on its way to you.

data.chText: 在路上；在行进中
data.enText: during the journey

data.chText: 他中途停下吃早点。
data.enText: He stopped for breakfast on the way.

data.chText: 她出门时一把抓起照相机和提包。
data.enText: She grabbed her camera and bag on her way out.

data.chText: 尚未出生的
data.enText: not yet born

data.chText: 他们有三个孩子，还有一个尚未出生。
data.enText: They've got three kids and one on the way.
the other way round

data.chText: 颠倒过来；相反；反过来
data.enText: in the opposite position, direction or order

data.chText: 我想这应该以相反的方式继续下去。
data.enText: I think it should go on the other way round.

data.chText: 相反的情况
data.enText: the opposite situation

data.chText: 我没有离开你。是你离开了我。
data.enText: I didn't leave you. It was the other way round (= you left me) .
out of the way

data.chText: 不再挡路；不再碍事
data.enText: no longer stopping sb from moving or doing sth

data.chText: 我挪开腿让她过去。
data.enText: I moved my legs out of the way so that she could get past.

data.chText: 我直到爸爸走开之后才说话。
data.enText: I didn't say anything until Dad was out of the way.

data.chText: 结束；处理完
data.enText: finished; dealt with

data.chText: 大选一结束，我们地区就准备发展。
data.enText: Our region is poised for growth once the election is out of the way.

data.chText: （用于否定句）奇特的，不寻常的，罕见的
data.enText: used in negative sentences to mean ‘unusual’

data.chText: 她显然没发现异常情况。
data.enText: She had obviously noticed nothing out of the way.
out of your way

data.chText: 不在计划走的路线上
data.enText: not on the route that you planned to take

data.chText: 我很想搭你的车回家，如果这不叫你绕路的话。
data.enText: I'd love a ride home─if it's not out of your way.
see your way (clear) to doing sth/to do sth

data.chText: 觉得有可能做某事；认为便于做某事
data.enText: to find that it is possible or convenient to do sth

data.chText: 小建筑商认为不可能招收很多见习生。
data.enText: Small builders cannot see their way clear to take on many trainees.
see which way the wind is blowing

data.chText: 看看风向；观察势头；摸清可能发生的情况
data.enText: to get an idea of what is likely to happen before doing sth
(not) stand in sb's way

data.chText: （不）妨碍别人
data.enText: to (not) prevent sb from doing sth

data.chText: 如果你相信你能使她幸福，我不会妨碍你的。
data.enText: If you believe you can make her happy, I won't stand in your way.
that's the way the cookie crumbles

data.chText: 情况就是这样；没有别的办法
data.enText: that is the situation and we cannot change it, so we must accept it
there's more than one way to skin a cat

data.chText: （要做成某事）方法不止一个，有的是办法
data.enText: there are many different ways to achieve sth
to my way of thinking

data.chText: 我认为；依我看；依我之见
data.enText: in my opinion
under way
underway

data.chText: 已经开始；在进行中
data.enText: having started

data.chText: 五月份特别活动周的准备工作已经顺利开展。
data.enText: Preparations are well under way for a week of special events in May.
a/the/sb's way of life

data.chText: （个人或群体的）特有的行为模式，典型生活方式
data.enText: the typical pattern of behaviour of a person or group

data.chText: 美国人的生活方式
data.enText: the American way of life
the way of the world

data.chText: 大多数人的行为模式；世道；事情发生的规律
data.enText: the way that most people behave; the way that things happen, which you cannot change

data.chText: 有钱有势者说了算，这就是世道。
data.enText: The rich and powerful make the decisions─that's the way of the world.
ways and means

data.chText: （做某事现有的）方法和资源，手段和财力
data.enText: the methods and materials available for doing sth

data.chText: 筹资办法
data.enText: ways and means of raising money
a way into sth
a way in to sth

data.chText: （加入难以进入的群体、行业等的）敲门砖；（弄懂难以理解事物的）窍门，诀窍
data.enText: something that allows you to join a group of people, an industry, etc. that it is difficult to join, or to understand sth that it is difficult to understand
the way to sb's heart

data.chText: 赢得某人喜爱的办法；攻心策
data.enText: the way to make sb like or love you

data.chText: 取得男人欢心的方法就是让他吃好。
data.enText: The way to a man's heart is through his stomach (= by giving him good food) .
way to go!

data.chText: 干得好
data.enText: used to tell sb that you are pleased about sth they have done

data.chText: 伙计们，活儿不错！干得好！
data.enText: Good work, guys! Way to go!
work your way through college, round the world, etc.

data.chText: 勤工俭学；半工半读；边挣钱边周游世界
data.enText: to have a job or series of jobs while studying, travelling, etc. in order to pay for your education, etc.
work your way through sth

data.chText: 自始至终做（尤指耗费时间或力量的事）
data.enText: to do sth from beginning to end, especially when it takes a lot of time or effort

data.chText: 她从头至尾处理了那一堆文件。
data.enText: She worked her way through the pile of documents.
work your way up

data.chText: 逐步升职；按部就班晋升
data.enText: to move regularly to a more senior position in a company

data.chText: 他从送信员一步一步晋升为客户经理。
data.enText: He worked his way up from messenger boy to account executive.
change your ways

data.chText: 开始过另一种生活；换个活法
data.enText: to start to live or behave in a different way from before
claw your way back, into sth, out of sth, to sth, etc.

data.chText: 努力逐步获得；艰难地移动
data.enText: to gradually achieve sth or move somewhere by using a lot of determination and effort

data.chText: 她拼死拼活地爬到了她职业的顶峰。
data.enText: She clawed her way to the top of her profession.

data.chText: 他艰难地从倒塌的大楼废墟底下慢慢爬了出来。
data.enText: Slowly, he clawed his way out from under the collapsed building.
clear the way (for sth/for sth to happen)

data.chText: （为…）清除障碍，扫清道路
data.enText: to remove things that are stopping the progress or movement of sth

data.chText: 这项裁决也许能为引渡程序铺平道路。
data.enText: The ruling could clear the way for extradition proceedings.
be (all) downhill
be downhill all the way

data.chText: （与前面的相比较）容易
data.enText: to be easy compared to what came before

data.chText: 从这以后就容易了。我们很快就会结束。
data.enText: It's all downhill from here. We'll soon be finished.

data.chText: 每况愈下；走下坡路；不断恶化
data.enText: to become worse or less successful

data.chText: 从那时起他的战绩便江河日下，五场比赛输掉了四场。
data.enText: It's been all downhill for his career since then, with four defeats in five games.

data.chText: 我开始当记者后，身体每况愈下。
data.enText: I started work as a journalist and it was downhill all the way for my health.
take the easy way out

data.chText: 以最简单的方法解决难题；快刀斩乱麻
data.enText: to end a difficult situation by choosing the simplest solution even if it is not the best one
see, realize, etc. the error of your ways

data.chText: 知过即改；承认自己的做法不对并决心改正

data.enText: or
to realize or admit that you have done sth wrong and decide to change your behaviour
(be/get) in the family way

data.chText: 怀孕；有喜
data.enText: (to be/become) pregnant
far and away

data.chText: 远为；大大地

before.chText: 后接形容词比较级或最高级
before.enText: followed by comparative or superlative adjectives

data.enText: by a very great amount

data.chText: 她是当之无愧的最佳选手。
data.enText: She's far and away the best player.
feel your way

data.chText: （如在黑暗中）摸索着走动
data.enText: to move along carefully, for example when it is dark, by touching walls, objects, etc.

data.chText: （在新环境中）谨慎行事
data.enText: to be careful about how you do things, usually because you are in a situation that you are not familiar with

data.chText: 她对这项工作不熟悉，还在摸索着干。
data.enText: She was new in the job, still feeling her way.
find your way (to…)

data.chText: 找到正确的路（去某处）
data.enText: to discover the right route (to a place)

data.chText: 希望你能找到回家的路。
data.enText: I hope you can find your way home.
the hard way

data.chText: 通过痛苦的经历；通过出错
data.enText: by having an unpleasant experience or by making mistakes

data.chText: 她不肯听我的忠告，所以只好吃了苦头才知道厉害。
data.enText: She won't listen to my advice so she'll just have to learn the hard way .
out of harm's way

data.chText: 在安全的地方；被隔离
data.enText: in a safe place where sb/sth cannot be hurt or injured or do any damage to sb/sth
have your head screwed on (the right way)

data.chText: 头脑清醒；理智
data.enText: to be a sensible person
know your way around

data.chText: 熟悉周围情况（或课题等）
data.enText: to be familiar with a place, subject, etc.
laugh all the way to the bank

data.chText: 发大财而喜笑颜开
data.enText: to make a lot of money easily and feel very pleased about it
lie your way into/out of sth

data.chText: 由于撒谎而处于某种境地（或摆脱某种处境）
data.enText: to get yourself into or out of a situation by lying
by a long way

data.chText: 大量地；大大地
data.enText: by a great amount
mend your ways

data.chText: 改过自新；改邪归正
data.enText: to stop behaving badly
(steer, take, etc.) a middle course
(find, etc.) a/the middle way

data.chText: （走）中间道路；（取）中庸之道；（采取）折中办法
data.enText: (to take/find) an acceptable course of action that avoids two extreme positions
open the way for sb/sth (to do sth)

data.chText: 开方便之门
data.enText: to make it possible for sb to do sth or for sth to happen
in the ordinary way

data.chText: 一般地；通常地
data.enText: used to say what normally happens in a particular situation

data.chText: 一般而言，她是个不爱紧张的人。
data.enText: In the ordinary way, she's not a nervous person.
a/the parting of the ways

data.chText: 岔路口；分道扬镳处；分手时刻
data.enText: a point at which two people or groups of people decide to separate
pave the way (for sb/sth)

data.chText: （为…）铺平道路，创造条件
data.enText: to create a situation in which sb will be able to do sth or sth can happen

data.chText: 这项决议为修改妇女就业权利创造了条件。
data.enText: This decision paved the way for changes in employment rights for women.
pay its way

data.chText: 赢利运作；不负债；收支平衡
data.enText: to make enough money to pay what it costs to keep it going

data.chText: 这座桥现在还入不敷出。
data.enText: The bridge is still not paying its way.
pick your way (across, along, among, over, through sth)

data.chText: 择路而行；小心看着路行走
data.enText: to walk carefully, choosing the safest, driest, etc. place to put your feet

data.chText: 她小心翼翼地在高低不平的地面上行走。
data.enText: She picked her way delicately over the rough ground.
rub sb up the wrong way
rub sb the wrong way

data.chText: （无意中）惹人生气，触怒别人
data.enText: to make sb annoyed or angry, often without intending to, by doing or saying sth that offends them
go your separate ways

data.chText: 断绝往来；分道扬镳
data.enText: to end a relationship with sb

data.chText: 分路而行；分手
data.enText: to go in a different direction from sb you have been travelling with
in any (way,) shape or form

data.chText: 任何形式
data.enText: of any type

data.chText: 我不赞成任何形式的暴力行为。
data.enText: I don't approve of violence in any shape or form.
show the way

data.chText: 示范
data.enText: to do sth first so that other people can follow
smooth the path/way

data.chText: 铺平道路
data.enText: to make it easier for sb/sth to develop or make progress

data.chText: 这些谈判目的在于为签订和平条约铺平道路。
data.enText: These negotiations are intended to smooth the path to a peace treaty.
in your own sweet time/way

data.chText: 任凭自己的意愿
data.enText: how and when you want to, even though this might annoy other people

data.chText: 工作他总是在做，但只在自己高兴的时候做。
data.enText: He always does the work, but in his own sweet time.
swing both ways

data.chText: 双性恋；既喜欢异性也喜欢同性
data.enText: to be bisexual (= sexually attracted to both men and women)
talk your way out of sth/of doing sth

data.chText: 靠能言善辩开脱；以话解围
data.enText: to make excuses and give reasons for not doing sth; to manage to get yourself out of a difficult situation

data.chText: 我好说歹说总算逃脱了发言差事。
data.enText: I managed to talk my way out of having to give a speech.
be well on the way to sth/doing sth

data.chText: 即将达到；将要成就
data.enText: to have nearly achieved sth and be going to achieve it soon

data.chText: 她就要康复了。
data.enText: She is well on the way to recovery.

data.chText: 他很快就会成为排名世界前十位的选手。
data.enText: He is well on the way to establishing himself among the top ten players in the world.
where there's a will there's a way

data.chText: 有志者事竟成
data.enText: if you really want to do sth then you will find a way of doing it
take sth the wrong way

data.chText: 误会本意良好的话
data.enText: to be offended by a remark that was not intended to be offensive
way back (in…)

data.chText: 很久以前
data.enText: a long time ago

data.chText: 我和他初次见面早在1980年代。
data.enText: I first met him way back in the 80s.

tr: how a result is obtained or an end is achieved
example: an example is the best agency of instruction
our paths in life led us apart
genius usually follows a revolutionary path

tr: any artifact consisting of a road or path affording passage from one place to another
example: he said he was looking for the way out

tr: how something is done or how it happens
example: in the characteristic New York style

tr: the property of distance in general
example: it's a long way to Moscow

tr: doing as one pleases or chooses
used in the expression `in the way of'
example: they didn't have much in the way of clothing

tr: a line leading to a place or point
a portion of something divided into shares
example: they split the loot three ways
hardly enough elbow room to turn around

tr: to a great degree or by a great distance
very much (`right smart' is regional in the United States)
example: the other side of the hill is right smart steeper than the side we are on

value.def: If you refer to a way of doing something, you are referring to how you can do it, for example the action you can take or the method you can use to achieve it.

example.ex: Freezing isn't a bad way of preserving food...
example.tran: 冷冻不失为一种保存食物的好方法。

example.ex: Another way of making new friends is to go to an evening class...
example.tran: 另一种交友的办法就是去上夜校。

example.ex: I worked myself into frenzy plotting ways to make him jealous...
example.tran: 我绞尽脑汁，处心积虑，就是为了让他嫉妒。

example.ex: I can't think of a worse way to spend my time...
example.tran: 我想不出更糟的消磨时间的办法。

example.ex: There just might be a way...
example.tran: 或许会有个什么办法。

example.ex: 'All right, Mrs Bates,' she said. 'We'll do it your way.'
example.tran: “好吧，贝茨夫人，”她说，“我们就按你说的办。”

value.def: If you talk about the way someone does something, you are talking about the qualities their action has.

example.ex: She smiled in a friendly way...
example.tran: 她友好地笑了笑。

example.ex: He had a strange way of talking...
example.tran: 他说话的方式怪怪的。

example.ex: I also used to love the smooth way in which the foreigner operated.
example.tran: 我也曾经喜欢那个老外平稳流畅的操作方式。

value.def: If a general statement or description is true in a particular way, this is the form of it that is true in a particular case.

example.ex: Computerized reservation systems help airline profits in several ways...
example.tran: 电子订票系统通过多种方式帮助航空公司获利。

example.ex: She was afraid in a way that was quite new to her...
example.tran: 她感到从未有过的害怕。

example.ex: To be female is not a disability; it is just a particular way of being human.
example.tran: 身为女性并不意味着不便;这只是人类一种特定的存在形式。

value.def: You use way in expressions such as in some ways ,in many ways, and in every way to indicate the degree or extent to which a statement is true.

example.ex: In some ways, the official opening is a formality...
example.tran: 从某些方面来说，正式的开幕仪式只不过是走个形式。

example.ex: She described her lover as 'perfect in every way'.
example.tran: 她形容她的爱人“各方面完美至极”。

value.def: The ways of a particular person or group of people are their customs or their usual behaviour.

example.ex: He denounces people who urge him to alter his ways...
example.tran: 他指责那些督促他改变习惯的人。

example.ex: I think you've been too long in Cornwall. You've forgotten the ways of the city...
example.tran: 我认为你们在康沃尔呆的太久了，已经忘记了城市的生活方式。

example.ex: He said he was against returning to old authoritarian ways.
example.tran: 他说他反对回到过去的独裁做法。

value.def: If you refer to someone's way, you are referring to their usual or preferred type of behaviour.

example.ex: She is now divorced and, in her usual resourceful way, has started her own business...
example.tran: 如今她离了婚。一贯足智多谋的她已开始自己创业。

example.ex: Direct confrontation was not his way.
example.tran: 正面冲突不是他的风格。

value.def: You use way to refer to one particular opinion or interpretation of something, when others are possible.

example.ex: I suppose that's one way of looking at it...
example.tran: 我想那是其中的一种看法。

example.ex: With most of Dylan's lyrics, however, there are other ways of interpreting the words...
example.tran: 但是，迪伦的大多数歌词都有其他的解读方式。

example.ex: Sometimes, the bank manager just doesn't see it your way.
example.tran: 有时银行经理和你看问题的角度就是不一样。

value.def: You use way when mentioning one of a number of possible, alternative results or decisions.

example.ex: There is no indication which way the vote could go...
example.tran: 没有迹象表明投票结果会怎样。

example.ex: The judge could have decided either way.
example.tran: 两种结果法官怎样判都有可能。

value.tran: 可能的后果;可能作出的决定

value.def: The way you feel about something is your attitude to it or your opinion about it.

example.ex: I'm terribly sorry — I had no idea you felt that way.
example.tran: 我非常抱歉——没有想到你是那样想的。

value.def: If you mention the way that something happens, you are mentioning the fact that it happens.

example.ex: I hate the way he manipulates people...
example.tran: 我讨厌他摆布别人。

example.ex: You may remember the way each scene ended with someone looking pensive or significant.
example.tran: 你或许还记得，每一场的结尾要么是某人作沉思状，要么是某人故作深沉。

value.def: You use way in expressions such as push your way ,work your way, or eat your way, followed by a prepositional phrase or adverb, in order to indicate movement, progress, or force as well as the action described by the verb.

example.ex: She thrust her way into the crowd...
example.tran: 她挤进了人群。

example.ex: He thought we were trying to buy our way into his company...
example.tran: 他以为我们是想通过贿赂进入他的公司。

example.ex: Start at the bottom and try to work your way up.
example.tran: 从底层干起，然后努力一步步升上去。

value.def: The way somewhere consists of the different places that you go through or the route that you take in order to get there.

example.ex: Does anybody know the way to the bathroom?...
example.tran: 有谁知道洗手间在哪里吗？

example.ex: I'm afraid I can't remember the way...
example.tran: 我恐怕不记得路了。

example.ex: We're not even a third of the way there...
example.tran: 我们才走了不到三分之一的路。

example.ex: We'll go out the back way.
example.tran: 我们从后门出去。

gramarinfo.label: usu <l>the</l> N in sing, oft N <l>to</l> n

value.def: If you go or look a particular way, you go or look in that direction.

example.ex: As he strode into the kitchen, he passed Pop coming the other way...
example.tran: 他大步走进厨房，与迎面而来的爸爸擦身而过。

example.ex: They paused at the top of the stairs, doubtful as to which way to go next...
example.tran: 他们在楼梯顶部停住了，不知道接下来该往哪边走。

example.ex: Could you look this way?
example.tran: 请往这边看好吗？

value.def: You can refer to the direction you are travelling in as your way .

example.ex: It's not very far out of his way...
example.tran: 就在他走的路上不远处。

example.ex: She would say she was going my way and offer me a lift.
example.tran: 她会说和我同路，可以载我一程。

value.def: If you lose your way, you take a wrong or unfamiliar route, so that you do not know how to get to the place that you want to go to. If you find your way, you manage to get to the place that you want to go to.

example.ex: The men lost their way in a sandstorm and crossed the border by mistake...
example.tran: 那些人在沙尘暴中迷了路，不小心穿越了边境。

example.ex: They've changed a lot of the old street names, and people can't find their way anymore.
example.tran: 许多老的街道名都被改了，人们再也找不到原来的路了。

value.def: You talk about people going their different ways in order to say that their lives develop differently and they have less contact with each other.

example.ex: It wasn't until we each went our separate ways that I began to learn how to do things for myself...
example.tran: 直到大家各奔东西，我才开始学着自力更生。

example.ex: You go your way and I'll go mine.
example.tran: 你走你的阳关道，我过我的独木桥。

value.def: If something comes your way, you get it or receive it.

example.ex: Take advantage of the opportunities coming your way in a couple of months...
example.tran: 把握住这几个月之内你可能获得的机会。

example.ex: If I run into anything that might interest you, I'll send it your way.
example.tran: 如果我碰上你可能感兴趣的东西，我就给你寄过去。

value.def: If someone or something is in the way, they prevent you from moving forward or seeing clearly.

example.ex: 'You're standing in the way,' she said. 'Would you mind moving aside'...
example.tran: “你挡着道了，”她说，“麻烦你让一下。”

example.ex: Get out of my way!
example.tran: 滚开！

value.def: Way is used in the names of some roads, and also in the names of some long paths for walkers in the countryside.

example.ex: Silvertown Way, was that the road?
example.tran: 锡尔弗敦路，是这条路么？

example.ex: ...the well-trodden 250-mile Pennine Way.
example.tran: 长250英里、人来人往的奔宁路

value.def: You can use way to refer to the area near where someone lives or near a specified place.

example.ex: If you speak standard English anywhere round our way, people tend to view you with suspicion.
example.tran: 如果你在我们这里说标准英语，大家就会对你产生怀疑。

example.ex: ...somebody from Newcastle way.
example.tran: 从纽卡斯尔那边来的人

value.tran: （某人居住地的）周边；特定的地区

value.def: You use way in expressions such as the right way up and the other way around to refer to one of two or more possible positions or arrangements that something can have.

example.ex: The flag was held the wrong way up by some spectators...
example.tran: 一些观众把旗子拿倒了。

example.ex: It's important to fit it the right way round.
example.tran: 将它安到正确位置上很重要。

value.def: You can use way to emphasize, for example, that something is a great distance away or is very much below or above a particular level or amount.

example.ex: Way down in the valley to the west is the town of Freiburg...
example.tran: 从这里往西远远的山谷中是弗赖堡镇。

example.ex: These exam results are way above average...
example.tran: 这些考试成绩远高于平均水平。

example.ex: I have to decide my plan way in advance.
example.tran: 我得趁早制订计划。

value.def: If you split something a number of ways, you divide it into a number of different parts or quantities, usually fairly equal in size.

example.ex: The region was split three ways, between Greece, Serbia and Bulgaria...
example.tran: 这一地区被希腊、塞尔维亚和保加利亚分成了3部分。

example.ex: Splitting the price six ways had still cost them each a bundle.
example.tran: 即使把价钱平摊成6份，每人也还是要花一大笔钱。

example.ex: ...a simple three-way division.
example.tran: 简单的三分法

value.def: Way is used in expressions such as a long way ,a little way, and quite a way, to say how far away something is or how far you have travelled.

example.ex: Some of them live in places quite a long way from here...
example.tran: 他们中有些人住的地方离这里很远。

example.ex: A little way further down the lane we passed the driveway to a house...
example.tran: 顺着巷子再走过去一点，我们经过车道来到一幢房子前。

example.ex: We've a fair way to go yet.
example.tran: 我们还有一大段路要走。

value.boxu_tran: 表示某地距某人所在地的距离可用away: Durban, which is over 300 kilometres away (距此超过300公里远的德班)。如果某地很远，可以用 a long way away 或 a long way from: It is a long way from London (它离伦敦很远)，Anna was still a long way away (安娜还在很远的地方)。far则多用于关于距离的否定句或疑问句中，通常不用于肯定句。
value.boxu_usage: If you want to state the distance of a particular place from where you are, you can say that it is that distance away. ...Durban, which is over 300 kilometres away. If a place is very distant, you can say that it is a long way away, or that it is a long way from another place. It is a long way from London... Anna was still a long way away. Far is used in negative sentences and questions about distance, but not usually in affirmative sentences.

value.def: Way is used in expressions such as a long way ,a little way, and quite a way, to say how far away in time something is.

example.ex: Success is still a long way off...
example.tran: 离成功还远着呢。

example.ex: August is still an awfully long way away.
example.tran: 离8月还早着呢。

value.def: You use way in expressions such as all the way ,most of the way and half the way to refer to the extent to which an action has been completed.

example.ex: He had unscrewed the caps most of the way...
example.tran: 他已经快把螺丝帽拧下来了。

example.ex: When was the last time you listened to an album all the way through?
example.tran: 你上一次完整地听完一张专辑是什么时候？

value.tran: (表示动作完成的程度)全部/多半/一半

value.def: If something is across the way, it is nearby on the opposite side of a road or area.

example.ex: ...the big gabled house across the way.
example.tran: 街对面那座带三角屋顶的大房子

value.def: You use all the way to emphasize how long a distance is.

example.ex: He had to walk all the way home...
example.tran: 他不得不一路步行回家。

example.ex: That dress came all the way from New York.
example.tran: 那条裙子是大老远从纽约送来的。

gramarinfo.label: usu PHR after v, oft PHR adv/prep

value.def: You can use all the way to emphasize that your remark applies to every part of a situation, activity, or period of time.

example.ex: Having started a revolution we must go all the way...
example.tran: 既然已经发动了革命，我们就一定要进行到底。

example.ex: I'll support him all the way.
example.tran: 我自始至终都会支持他。

value.def: You can use as is the way to say that a particular situation or example of behaviour is typical and you would not expect it to be different.

example.ex: As is the way with these gatherings, the declarations were largely drafted before the delegations arrived.
example.tran: 就像通常的这种集会一样，宣言内容在代表团到达之前就差不多拟好了。

value.def: If you say that someone is in a bad way, you mean that they are very ill or unhealthy.

example.ex: He's in a bad way, but able to talk.
example.tran: 他病得很重，但还能说话。

value.def: If you say that something exists, happens, or develops in a big way, you are emphasizing its great extent or importance.

example.ex: The man who took over a few weeks later has also helped further her career in a big way...
example.tran: 几周后上台的那个人也帮助她把事业推进了一大步。

example.ex: Soccer in the States has never taken off in a big way.
example.tran: 足球在美国从来就没获得过大发展。

value.def: If someone says that you can't have it both ways, they are telling you that you have to choose between two things and cannot do or have them both.

example.ex: Countries cannot have it both ways: the cost of a cleaner environment may sometimes be fewer jobs in dirty industries...
example.tran: 各国不可能两全其美：环境更清洁的代价有时可能就是污染企业就业岗位的减少。

example.ex: Make up your mind, you can't have it both ways.
example.tran: 你决定吧，反正鱼与熊掌不可兼得。

value.def: You say by the way when you add something to what you are saying, especially something that you have just thought of.

example.ex: The name Latifah, by the way, means 'delicate'...
example.tran: 顺便说一句，Latifah 这个名字意思是“娇嫩”。

example.ex: By the way, how did your seminar go?
example.tran: 对了，你的研讨会进行得怎样？

value.def: You use by way of when you are explaining the purpose of something that you have said or are about to say. For example, if you say something by way of an introduction, you say it as an introduction.

example.ex: By way of contrast, Manchester United will travel slightly more than 1,200 miles...
example.tran: 相比而言，曼联队的行程将略多于1,200英里。

example.ex: 'I get very superstitious about things like that,' she said by way of explanation.
example.tran: “在那种事儿上我会很迷信，”她解释道。

value.def: If you do something by way of a particular method, you use that method to do it.

example.ex: I teach psychology by way of a range of traditional lectures, practicals and tutorials.
example.tran: 我采用传统授课与实践和指导相结合的方式教授心理学。

value.def: If you go somewhere by way of a particular place, you go through that place in order to get to where you want.

example.ex: The path goes under the river by way of the tunnel.
example.tran: 这条通道经隧道从河下经过。

value.def: If someone changes their ways or mends their ways, they permanently improve their behaviour or their way of doing something.

example.ex: What can be done to encourage convicted offenders to change their ways?
example.tran: 怎样才能激励这些罪犯洗心革面呢？

value.def: If you clear the way ,open the way, or prepare the way for something, you create an opportunity for it to happen.

example.ex: The talks are meant to clear the way for formal negotiations on a new constitution...
example.tran: 会谈旨在为新宪法的正式商讨扫清道路。

example.ex: The decision could open the way for other children to sue their parents.
example.tran: 这项判决可能会为其他孩子起诉他们的父母开辟一条通道。

value.def: If you say that someone takes the easy way out, you disapprove of them because they do what is easiest for them in a difficult situation, rather than dealing with it properly.

example.ex: As soon as things got difficult he took the easy way out...
example.tran: 事情刚变得有点棘手他就急忙脱身。

example.ex: It is the easy way out to blame others for our failure.
example.tran: 把我们的失败归罪到别人头上倒是省事。

value.tran: (采取)最容易的办法，最省事的做法(以回避困难或尴尬处境)

value.def: You use either way in order to introduce a statement which is true in each of the two possible or alternative cases that you have just mentioned.

example.ex: The sea may rise or the land may fall; either way the sand dunes will be gone in a short time.
example.tran: 可能会出现海平面上升或陆地下沉:不论发生哪种情况，沙丘都会在短时间内消失。

value.tran: (两种情况中)不论发生哪一种情况

value.def: If you say that a particular type of action or development is the way forward, you approve of it because it is likely to lead to success.

example.ex: ...people who genuinely believe that anarchy is the way forward...
example.tran: 真的相信无政府主义才是未来出路的人

example.ex: Young players have got to be the way forward for every club.
example.tran: 培养年轻球员应该是所有俱乐部谋求发展之道。

value.def: If someone gets their way or has their way, nobody stops them doing what they want to do. You can also say that someone gets their own way or has their own way .

example.ex: She is very good at using her charm to get her way.
example.tran: 她非常善于利用自己的魅力随心所欲。

value.tran: 想怎样就怎样;随心所欲

value.def: If one thing gives way to another, the first thing is replaced by the second.

example.ex: First he had been numb. Then the numbness gave way to anger...
example.tran: 起初他只是麻木，接着转为了愤怒。

example.ex: The last houses give way to soybean fields.
example.tran: 最后一批房子也被拆掉用作了大豆地。

value.def: If an object that is supporting something gives way, it breaks or collapses, so that it can no longer support that thing.

example.ex: The hook in the ceiling had given way and the lamp had fallen blazing on to the table.
example.tran: 天花板上的钩子断了，灯落下来砸到桌子上燃起了火。

value.def: If you give way to someone or something that you have been resisting, you stop resisting and allow yourself to be persuaded or controlled by them.

example.ex: It seems the President has given way to pressure from the hardliners...
example.tran: 总统似乎已迫于强硬派的压力而妥协了。

example.ex: He finally gave way to an impulse and pulled her toward him.
example.tran: 他最终还是没能抑制住冲动，把她拉向了自己。

value.def: If a moving person, a vehicle, or its driver gives way, they slow down or stop in order to allow other people or vehicles to pass in front of them.

example.ex: Give way to traffic coming from the left.
example.tran: 让从左边来的车先行。

value.tran: 让路;让其他人(或车辆)先行

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 yield

value.def: If you say that someone or something has a way of doing a particular thing, you mean that they often do it.

example.ex: Bosses have a way of always finding out about such things.
example.tran: 老板总喜欢把这类事情搞清楚。

value.def: If you say hat a person has a way with something or someone, you mean that that person seems to have a natural skill or instinct for dealing with them.

example.ex: Constance doesn't have a way with words like you do...
example.tran: 康斯坦丝没有你这么健谈。

example.ex: He seems to have had a way with foreigners.
example.tran: 他似乎天生就善于和外国人交往。

value.tran: 善于与(某人或某事物)打交道

value.def: If you say have it your way or have it your own way, you are telling someone in an annoyed way that you will agree with or accept their suggestion even though you do not think they are right.

example.ex: All right then, have it your way. Be like that.
example.tran: 那好吧，随你的便。就那样吧。

value.def: You use in no way or not in any way to emphasize that a statement is not at all true.

example.ex: In no way am I going to adopt any of his methods...
example.tran: 我绝对不会采纳他的任何方法。

example.ex: A spokesman insisted the two events were 'in no way related'...
example.tran: 一位发言人坚称这两起事件“绝无关联”。

example.ex: 'He hasn't become more boring has he?' she laughs. 'No. Not in any way.'
example.tran: “他不会变得更烦人了吧？”她笑着问。“不，一点也没有。”

value.def: If you say that something is true in a way, you mean that although it is not completely true, it is true to a limited extent or in certain respects. You use in a way to reduce the force of a statement.

example.ex: In a way, I suppose I'm frightened of failing...
example.tran: 我想我有点惧怕失败。

example.ex: It made things very unpleasant in a way.
example.tran: 这把事情弄得有点不大愉快。

value.tran: (用于缓和语气)在某种程度上，在某些方面

value.def: If you say that someone does something in a small way, you mean that although they do not do very much, their actions are useful or important.

example.ex: ...demonstrations against corruption, which began in a small way last week...
example.tran: 上周开始的小规模的反腐示威游行

example.ex: By doing this you will, in a small way, help win the victory.
example.tran: 这样做你就会为获胜贡献一份小小的力量。

gramarinfo.label: PHR after v, PHR with cl

value.def: If you say that someone gets in the way or is in the way, you are annoyed because their presence or their actions stop you doing something properly.

example.ex: 'We wouldn't get in the way,' Suzanne promised. 'We'd just stand quietly in a corner.'
example.tran: “我们不会妨碍你的，”苏珊娜保证道，“我们就在角落里安安静静地站着。”

value.def: To get in the way of something means to make it difficult for it to happen, continue, or be appreciated properly.

example.ex: She had a job which never got in the way of her leisure interests.
example.tran: 她有一份从来不会影响她的业余爱好的工作。

value.def: If you know your way around a particular subject, system, or job, or if you know your way about it, you know all the procedures and facts about it.

example.ex: He knows his way around the intricate maze of European law...
example.tran: 他通晓错综复杂的欧洲律法。

example.ex: He knows his way about the system better than do most ministers.
example.tran: 他比大多数部长都更熟悉这套体系。

trans: 顺便说一句；顺便地;附带说一句
路经，途经；作为，当作；意在，为了
同样；同样的方法；同样的感受
(强调距离)一路；自始至终;一直；一路
